revised_title: Contact Metamorphism in Silurian Rocks Near New Galloway, Southern Uplands of Scotland
tldr: This study examines the effects of contact metamorphism on Silurian rocks near the town of New Galloway in the Southern Uplands of Scotland. The research focuses on the changes in mineral composition and structure as a result of the intrusion of granite. The altered rocks exhibit various mineralogical and structural changes, including the formation of new minerals and the transformation of existing ones.
